nodes.caption: PUSH FACTORS I want to study abroad as I do not like the Indian way of teaching (e4) I have decided to study abroad as I am not able to get the course or facilities of my choice in my country (e5) I will not get good jobs in my country.
PULL FACTORS Living conditions are better outside India (e1) Foreign education offers more value and stability (e2) I will be more successful if I study outside India (e3)

INSTITUTIONAL INTERVENTIONS My university encourages students to go for study abroad programs (e7) My university offers unique and innovative study abroad programs (e8) My university has clear policies, procedures & systems for helping students who want to study abroad (e9)

FULFILLMENT My study abroad program was well designed and executed (e10) My study abroad program was a great learning experience on a personal level (e11) I gained a lot of academic value from my study abroad program (e12)
SEM MODEL FOR INTERNATIONAL STUDENT MOBILITY
